tit.e: The history of Nanki Tokugawa clan.
The history of Nanki Tokugawa clan.
The history of Nanki Tokugawa clan.

sen.j: 『南紀徳川史』（なんきとくがわし）とは、明治に完成した紀州藩の歴史書。
sen.e: "The history of Nanki Tokugawa clan" refers to a history book of the Kishu Domain, completed in Meiji period.
"The history of Nanki Tokugawa clan" refers to a history book of the Kishu Domain, completed in Meiji period.
"The history of Nanki Tokugawa clan" refers to a history book of the Kishu Domain, completed in Meiji period.

sen.j: 明治21年（1888年）に紀州徳川家当主・徳川茂承によって編纂が開始され、明治34年（1901年）に完成した。
sen.e: In 1888 Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the family head of Kishu Tokugawa family, started to compile and completed it in 1901.
In 1888 Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the family head of Kishu Tokugawa family, started to compile and completed it in 1901.
In 1888 Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the family head of Kishu Tokugawa family, started to compile and completed it in 1901.

sen.j: 編纂者は旧紀州藩士・堀内信。
sen.e: The compiler was Nobu HORIUCHI, old feudal retainer of Kishu Domain.
The compiler was Makoto HORIUCHI, old feudal retainer of Kishu Domain.
sen.cmt: 「堀内信」の読み方を変更しました：http://www.kitohan.sakuraweb.com/kumano-kodou/ooheji/nagaizaka/susami-eki-nishihama/s2003-03-02-susami-no025-yama-matome.htm
sen.e: The compiler was Makoto HORIUCHI, old feudal retainer of Kishu Domain.

sen.j: 徳川頼宣が生まれた慶長7年（1602年）から廃藩置県が行われて茂承が東京府に移住する明治4年（1871年）までの期間を扱う。
sen.e: It describes the period of time from 1602 when Yorinobu TOKUGAWA was born to 1871 when Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) was done and Mochitsugu moved to Tokyo Prefecture.

It describes the period of time from 1602 when Yorinobu TOKUGAWA was born, to 1871 when Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) was done and Mochitsugu moved to Tokyo Prefecture.
sen.cmt: "Yorinobu TOKUGAWA was born"の後にカンマを挿入しました
sen.e: It describes the period of time from 1602 when Yorinobu TOKUGAWA was born, to 1871 when Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures) was done and Mochitsugu moved to Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 刊本は18冊（本文17冊、総目録1冊）。
sen.e: The number of volumes is 18 (the body text 17 volumes, the bibliography 1 volume).
The number of volumes is 18 (the body text 17 volumes, the bibliography 1 volume).
The number of volumes is 18 (the body text 17 volumes, the bibliography 1 volume).

sen.j: 紀州徳川家当主・徳川茂承（第14代紀州藩主）の命によって編纂が開始され、旧紀州藩士・堀内信が明治21年（1888年）から明治34年（1901年）にかけて編纂を行った。
sen.e: It started by the order of Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the family head of Kishu Tokugawa family (the fourteenth lord of Kishu Domain), and an old feudal retainer of Kishu Domain Nobu HORIUCHI compiled from 1888 to 1901.

The compilation started by the order of Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the family head of Kishu Tokugawa family (the fourteenth lord of Kishu Domain), and an old feudal retainer of Kishu Domain Makoto HORIUCHI was responsible for the compilation from 1888 to 1901.
sen.cmt: ・5列原文に倣い、主語として「編纂が」を補足しました（原文・訳文共に修正）・Nobu HORIUCHI compiled→Makoto HORIUCHI was responsible for the compilation
sen.e: The compilation started by the order of Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the family head of Kishu Tokugawa family (the fourteenth lord of Kishu Domain), and an old feudal retainer of Kishu Domain Makoto HORIUCHI was responsible for the compilation from 1888 to 1901.

sen.j: 明治32年（1899年）4月に前集70巻の浄書2部が完成し、1部が紀州徳川家へ納められ、別の1部が紀州東照宮へ奉納された。
sen.e: In April 1899 the former 70 volumes were completed and some parts of them were dedicated to Kishu Tokugawa family and the other parts were dedicated to Kishu Tosho-gu Shrine.
In April 1899, two clean copies of the former 70 volumes were completed, and one copy was dedicated to Kishu Tokugawa family while the other was dedicated to Kishu Tosho-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 「浄書2部」を訳出し、それに伴い全体を改変しました（浄書は用語共有に登録しました）
sen.e: In April 1899, two clean copies of the former 70 volumes were completed, and one copy was dedicated to Kishu Tokugawa family while the other was dedicated to Kishu Tosho-gu Shrine.

sen.j: 明治34年（1901年）には後集100巻が完成し、紀州徳川家へ納められた。
sen.e: In 1901 the latter 100 volumes were completed and dedicated to Kishu Tokugawa family.
In 1901 the latter 100 volumes were completed and dedicated to Kishu Tokugawa family.
In 1901 the latter 100 volumes were completed and dedicated to Kishu Tokugawa family.

sen.j: 昭和5年（1930年）から昭和8年（1933年）にかけて南紀徳川史刊行会が刊行し、昭和45年（1970年）から昭和47年（1972年）にかけて名著出版より復刻刊行された。
sen.e: From 1930 to 1933 Nanki Tokugawa History Publishing Association published them and from 1970 to 1972 they were reprinted by Meicho Publication.
From 1930 to 1933 Nanki Tokugawa History Publishing Association published them, and from 1970 to 1972, they were reprinted by Meicho Publication.
sen.cmt: from 1970 to 1972の前後にカンマを補足しました
sen.e: From 1930 to 1933 Nanki Tokugawa History Publishing Association published them, and from 1970 to 1972, they were reprinted by Meicho Publication.

tit.cmt: 文章ではないのでピリオドは削除しました
文章ではないのでピリオドは削除しました
